You can easily customize the content of your website by modifying the following directories:
The content displayed on your website pages can be found in the
directory. Simply open the respective files to edit the text and layout as needed.

<template>
  <AppHeader title="Staff" />

  <Container>
    <!-- List of available colors can be found here: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/colors. -->

    <StaffGroup title="Management">
      <StaffMember name="Notch" rank="Owner" color="bg-red-700" />
      <StaffMember name="jeb_" rank="Lead developer" color="bg-yellow-700" />
    </StaffGroup>

    <StaffGroup title="Moderators">
      <StaffMember name="Rushboe" rank="Moderator" color="bg-blue-700" />
      <StaffMember name="Steve" rank="Moderator" color="bg-blue-700" />
      <StaffMember name="C418" rank="Trial moderator" color="bg-cyan-700" />
    </StaffGroup>
  </Container>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
useHead({
  title: 'Staff',
});
</script>
<!-- List of available colors can be found here: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/colors. -->
Navigation links like the header menu can be configured in the
file. You can edit the title, URL, icon, colors, and whether the link opens in a new tab. Example:

navigationLinks: [
  { title: 'Rules', to: '/rules', icon: 'fa-solid fa-scroll', colors: 'bg-emerald-800 hover:bg-emerald-900 border-emerald-950', external: false, blank: false },
  { title: 'Wiki', to: '/wiki', icon: 'fa-solid fa-book', colors: 'bg-purple-800 hover:bg-purple-900 border-purple-950', external: false, blank: false },
  { title: 'Store', to: '/store', icon: 'fa-solid fa-cart-shopping', colors: 'bg-amber-800 hover:bg-amber-900 border-amber-950', external: false, blank: false },
  { title: 'Voting', to: '/voting', icon: 'fa-solid fa-check-to-slot', colors: 'bg-rose-800 hover:bg-rose-900 border-rose-950', external: false, blank: false },
  { title: 'Staff', to: '/staff', icon: 'fa-solid fa-map', colors: 'bg-lime-800 hover:bg-lime-900 border-lime-950', external: false, blank: false },
]
For advanced users, components can be further customized by editing files in the
directory. This allows you to change layout, structure, or add new features, but these modifications are only recommended for users comfortable with Vue and TypeScript.

for instructions on how to set up and edit your own Wiki.

Learn how to customize the content of your website.
Easy guide for setting up your new Minecraft server website.

Welcome to the documentation for this software! This website template is based on the Nuxt framework and provides a full-featured and modern solution for your Minecraft server. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us on our Discord server.
Required setup and tools for hosting and using the template.
Before you get started with the template, there are a few prerequisites to consider.
The website can be fully hosted on a static hosting service.If you wish to utilize the Player Voting Leaderboard feature, you will need a PHP hosting service.

Ensure that you have Node.js installed on your computer. This is required to run the development server and manage packages.A code editor is recommended for editing the template files. One of the suggested editors is Visual Studio Code, though any editor of your choice will work. Once you have these prerequisites in place, you’ll be ready to start customizing your website!
Steps to install the template and start the development server.
To get started with the template, follow these simple steps to install the project and run the development server.
First, extract the ZIP file you downloaded. Then, navigate to the extracted project directory using your terminal or command prompt:
Once you're in the project directory, run the following command to install the necessary packages:

After the installation is complete, you can start the development server with the following command: This will launch the development server, allowing you to view and test your website in your browser at . Now you're ready to start customizing your website! Guide for deploying your website on a hosting service.
Once you have customized your website and are ready to make it live, follow these steps to deploy your project.
Before deploying, you need to create a production-ready build of your website. Run the following command in your project directory:
After generating the static files, you can upload them to your chosen static hosting service, such as Netlify or Vercel. Simply upload the contents of the  folder to your hosting provider.

Once deployed, visit your website's URL to verify that everything is functioning as expected. Congratulations! Guide on how to create pages and structure navigation in the wiki.

This page provides guidelines on how to create pages within the Wiki and how navigation is structured automatically based on your content. Understanding these elements will help you contribute effectively to the Wiki.
Directory StructureCreating a PagePage MetadataLinks and NavigationCategory TitlesBest PracticesPrerendering New Pages
Pages in this Wiki should be organized within the  directory in a structured format that reflects their category and order. The basic organization looks like this:

Each folder and file is prefixed with a number to indicate its priority.Use folders to group related pages by category.Pages should follow the pattern , meaning one level of category followed by the page itself.Avoid creating deeper nested folders beyond one category level.
Based on the above structure, the internal paths would be: →  →  →  →

To create a new page in the Wiki, follow these steps: Navigate to the relevant category folder where you want to add the new page.Create a new Markdown file with a relevant name (e.g., ).Place the file in the appropriate category folder, following the numbering convention.Add the required metadata at the top of the file, including  and .Write your content using Markdown syntax.Save the file in the appropriate directory.

Each page should include metadata at the top in YAML format. This metadata helps in generating navigation and indexing pages. Here’s what to include: title: The title of the page, which will be displayed in the navigation and page header.description: A brief description of the page's content, used for SEO and context.
Navigation in the Wiki is generated automatically based on the structure of your pages. When you create a page with a title and proper structure, it will appear in the navigation menu.
To link to other pages, use the following Markdown syntax: For example, to link to a page titled "Breakfast":

If you want to change the displayed name of a category in the navigation, you can add a  file inside the category folder. Example: With the following content: This will override the displayed category name in the navigation.

Consistent Naming: Use clear and consistent naming conventions for your pages and links to make them easily identifiable.Logical Structure: Organize pages in a single-level category structure to improve navigation.Use Descriptive Titles: Ensure that the titles and descriptions of your pages accurately reflect the content to enhance discoverability.Regular Updates: Keep pages updated with relevant information to maintain their usefulness.

When you add a new page to the Wiki, you need to ensure that it is included in the static prerendering process if you are generating a static site. Open .Locate the  array.Add the path of your new page, e.g.: This step is necessary because dynamic  pages are not automatically known to Nuxt during the static generation process. Always add newly created pages to this array to ensure they are pre-rendered. By following these guidelines, you can contribute effectively to the Wiki and ensure that it remains a valuable resource for all users. html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html pre.shiki code .s4JwU, html code.shiki .s4JwU{--shiki-default:#85E89D}html pre.shiki code .s95oV, html code.shiki .s95oV{--shiki-default:#E1E4E8}html pre.shiki code .sU2Wk, html code.shiki .sU2Wk{--shiki-default:#9ECBFF}html pre.shiki code .svObZ, html code.shiki .svObZ{--shiki-default:#B392F0}
Examples of using Markdown for formatting content.
This is a page with examples demonstrating how to use Markdown for formatting content in a wiki-style page.
HeadingsText formattingListsUnordered ListOrdered ListLinks and ImagesLinksImagesCode BlocksInline CodeBlock of CodeTable

Headings in Markdown are created by placing one or more hash symbols  at the beginning of a line. The number of hash symbols used indicates the level of the heading, from level 1 (the largest) to level 6 (the smallest). Here are examples of each heading level:
Bold text is written using double asterisks: .Italic text is written using single asterisks: .Strikethrough text is done with double tildes: .
Use  before the text to create a blockquote. This is a blockquote, useful for highlighting quotes or important text.
Use  or  to create a horizontal rule:
Here’s a link to Nuxt Documentation.
To highlight inline code, use backticks .
To create a multiline code block, use three backticks  followed by the language type (e.g., ) on the next line. Here's an example:

Instructions for setting up the Voting Leaderboard with VotingPlugin.
If you have access to PHP hosting, you can utilize the Voting Leaderboard feature. This leaderboard is designed to work with the VotingPlugin.
Step 1: Enable the Leaderboard in Configuration
First, ensure that the Voting Leaderboard is enabled in your configuration file. Open the  file and verify that you have the following line set to :

Next, copy the  file from the  folder and upload it to your PHP hosting. You will need to fill in the database connection details in the  file. Locate the following section in the file: Make sure to provide the correct values for your database connection.
Ensure that the VotingPlugin is connected to the database correctly. You may want to test the database connection to confirm everything is set up properly.
Step 4: Set the Voting API URL
After successfully uploading and configuring the  file, return to the  file and set the  to point to your hosted  file: Replace  with the actual URL where you uploaded the  file.

With these steps completed, your Voting Leaderboard should be ready to go!
